summary.long: 2 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers in a pure conscience, how unceasing is my remembrance of thee in my supplications, night and day
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: longing to see thee, remembering thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been reminded of the unfeigned faith that is in thee; which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and, I am persuaded, in thee also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which cause I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee through the laying on of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God gave us not a spirit of fearfulness; but of power and love and discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not ashamed therefore of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but suffer hardship with the gospel according to the power of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who saved us, and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before times eternal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but hath now been manifested by the appearing of our Saviour Christ Jesus, who abolished death, and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereunto I was appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which cause I suffer also these things: yet I am not ashamed; for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed unto him against that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold the pattern of sound words which thou hast heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That good thing which was committed unto thee guard through the Holy Spirit which dwelleth in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This thou knowest, that all that are in Asia turned away from me; of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord grant mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus: for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently, and found me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the Lord grant unto him to find mercy of the Lord in that day); and in how many things he ministered at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the things which thou hast heard from me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suffer hardship with me, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No soldier on service entangleth himself in the affairs of this life; that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if also a man contend in the games, he is not crowned, except he have contended lawfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husbandman that laboreth must be the first to partake of the fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider what I say; for the Lord shall give thee understanding in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my gospel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein I suffer hardship unto bonds, as a malefactor; but the word of God is not bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithful is the saying: For if we died with him, we shall also live with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we endure, we shall also reign with him: if we shall deny him, he also will deny us:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we are faithless, he abideth faithful; for he cannot deny himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they strive not about words, to no profit, to the subverting of them that hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give diligence to present thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, handling aright the word of truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But shun profane babblings: for they will proceed further in ungodliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their word will eat as doth a gangrene: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already, and overthrow the faith of some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit the firm foundation of God standeth, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his: and, Let every one that nameth the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some unto honor, and some unto dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honor, sanctified, meet for the master’s use, prepared unto every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But flee youthful lusts, and follow after righteousness, faith, love, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But foolish and ignorant questionings refuse, knowing that they gender strifes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord’s servant must not strive, but be gentle towards all, apt to teach, forbearing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in meekness correcting them that oppose themselves; if peradventure God may give them repentance unto the knowledge of the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, having been taken captive by him unto his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that in the last days grievous times shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For men shall be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, haughty, railers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without natural affection, implacable, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, no lovers of good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: traitors, headstrong, puffed up, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding a form of godliness, but having denied the power thereof: from these also turn away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For of these are they that creep into houses, and take captive silly women laden with sins, led away by divers lusts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also withstand the truth; men corrupted in mind, reprobate concerning the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be evident unto all men, as theirs also came to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou didst follow my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecutions, sufferings; what things befell me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: and out of them all the Lord delivered me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and all that would live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But evil men and impostors shall wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But abide thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that from a babe thou hast known the sacred writings which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every scripture inspired of God is also profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, for instruction which is in righteousness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the man of God may be complete, furnished completely unto every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charge thee in the sight of God, and of Christ Jesus, who shall judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: preach the word; be urgent in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort, with all longsuffering and teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time will come when they will not endure the sound doctrine; but, having itching ears, will heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn aside unto fables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be thou sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, fulfil thy ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure is come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: henceforth there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give to me at that day; and not to me only, but also to all them that have loved his appearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give diligence to come shortly unto me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Demas forsook me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee; for he is useful to me for ministering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Tychicus I sent to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, bring when thou comest, and the books, especially the parchments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord will render to him according to his works:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of whom do thou also beware; for he greatly withstood our words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my first defence no one took my part, but all forsook me: may it not be laid to their account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me; that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will save me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Erastus remained at Corinth: but Trophimus I left at Miletus sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give diligence to come before winter. Eubulus saluteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord be with thy spirit. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
